storyInfo: Mayer's efforts to implement a smart upgrade for the Meeboos have failed again. Perhaps there will be a next time, but what would happen then?

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Landship
'Lutra Workshop'
Don't blink now, Closure.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER, select M-11 Originium isolation coating from the table.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: (There's a dozen types of coating here, and they all pretty much look and feel the same sans packaging.)
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Got it in one.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: C'mon, that's just basic stuff.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: There's a broken component in this thermal sensor. Repair it in three minutes, Meeboo SUPER.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Repair complete. There is an electronic component under the base that compromises thermal sensor efficiency. It has been removed without affecting device operation.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Sweet! Took less than two!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Wow! It talks!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What's a smart upgrade without a voice module?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Took some time to get used to it myself. It's not exactly the chatty type, though.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Did you really have to make the voice so gruff though...? Whatever, to each their own.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Keep going.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER, set a new password for the workshop door.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Password set using a combination of alphanumeric characters in upper and lower cases, and special characters. Password does not include your birthday.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Alright, awesome!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Applied testing, phase one complete!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: And there you have it, the new, the improved, the Meeboo SUPER! So? What'd ya think? Smarter than your AI buggies, right?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Sure is a clever little guy! But Lancet-2 or Castle-3 could do all that, no problem.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Hey, no biting! You're just like Mayer!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Let her go for now, Meeboo SUPER.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Can't tell if its performance is better than the buggies, but it sure holds a grudge better.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Stay away!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: So, how much time did this upgrade take you?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Lemme see... three months, ish?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Closure, Closure! I've got that 'Raythean Challenger Hellcat Demon High-Performance Operation Platform' upgrade proposal you wanted!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Thanks. Next up is—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Nah, I need a month off.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Whoa, a workaholic like you? Burnt out? Or... are you looking for a raise?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: No way, you know me.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Just finished up all my requests from Rhine Lab and Rhodes Island, so my schedule's a clear blue sky.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: And it's high time I upgraded the Meeboos.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Haven't you been doing that in your spare time? What do you need more time for all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Three more Meeboos have gone kaput the last few months, and there's still a whole pile waiting for repair.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: There's only one 1st-gen left.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Aw, poor little guys.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Their efficiency's improved, but survival rate remains poor in adverse environments, or operations requiring a high degree of precision.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Implementing a full AI should let 'em properly take care of themselves while performing their tasks.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Oh, I'll help then!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Thanks, but no thanks. I'll be fine on my own.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Why not? Didn't we work together on Iwona's Justice Knight?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: That was a PRTS-based customization. Not even you know the ins and outs of the buggies' operational algorithms.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: That's not what I want for my babies. From Rhine to Rhodes, I've always worked on 'em myself.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I'll give you a shout if I've got any questions, though.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I'd installed a learning system on 'em, but that's not even in the same ballpark as true 'intelligence.' Needed to start from scratch.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: First I tried optimizing the existing Meeboo core to improve its automation logic, but the results weren't too great.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: So I rewrote the underlying code... Which took a while.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Original plan called for five SUPER prototypes to get some proper control experiments in, but I only managed to finish one.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Still! This Meeboo SUPER is an unprecedented achievement with applications in highly complex environments, including demolition, surveying, reconnaissance, combat, and everyday life.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Most importantly, it can complete precise operations fully independently.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: It'll be the most powerful smart machine in all Terra... Small and easy to mass produce too. Makes your customized buggies look like a science fair project.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: We're talking about a whole Meeboo army!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: So what's this tag on it?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Nametag. Got one on every Meeboo.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: But why so many? Let's see, C00-1, B03-4, B12, G70...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Took 'em off of decommissioned Meeboos.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Yeah, I know, but weren't those supposed to go in the Great Meeboos Monument? Did you...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: So the Meeboo SUPER carries on its brothers' hopes and dreams?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Hehe.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: But you still left yourself control permissions for the Meeboo's core, yeah?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I guess.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Then it's not quite 'smart' enough, yet.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I'll start the next phase of applied testing in a couple days.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I'll see you then, then.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: By the way, make sure you've got the settings right on the Meeboo SUPER's demolition program. We are on the landship, after all...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Now I just gotta log today's test data.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Hey, are you even listening, Mayer?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I know, I know.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Oh, right, what's the new door password, Meeboo SUPER?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Huh... Is that a bug?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.text: Meeboo SUPER Test Log 07
Continuing applied testing for the Meeboo SUPER prototype today.
I'll temporarily disable my control permissions for the Meeboo core, allowing the Meeboo SUPER to autonomously inspect nearby buildings and resolve potential problems.
This is the most important stage.
Meeboo has learned to speak, though we're both still getting used to it. It's learning to complete more complex tasks; it's no longer just a 'walking bomb.'
However, this is the first time ever that a Meeboo will be operating outside my control.

If successful, it will mean that the Meeboos have truly reached the stage of artificial intelligence, without relying on the Rhodes Island mainframe, which is very important for both Lutra Workshop and the Meeboos.
Although there have been some occasional data deviations, based on the Meeboo SUPER's performance to date, I think there's a lot to look forward to in today's testing.
After all, every last Meeboo is lending us their strength.

attributes.content: Core control permission off.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER, scan and resolve potential issues for buildings in the designated area.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Of course, since we're on the Rhodes Island Landship, you'll need to...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Oh, what am I saying, you're smart, you know what to do, right? Haha.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Whew—
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Now just gotta wait for it to finish the job and come back.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Wow, the requests sure have piled up... Guess I really put 'em off for too long.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Let's see... wall projectors for operator quarters, weapons system upgrade for the training grounds, synchronization between drones and charging equipment...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: And the workshop's a mess.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Might as well clean up the operating console while I have time.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo— SUPER. Scanning building. Resolving potential problems. Scanning building. Resolving potential problems.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: 8 structural integrity issues found. Calculating. Issues resolved using method—
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: One remaining structure to inspect.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: 'Lutra Workshop'
There, that's more like it!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Full-area scan.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Retrieving comparison data. Activating analysis.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Results—
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Area is larger than expected. Lacks distinction between living and working space. Presence of dangerous equipment—
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Warning. Resolving potential issue. Evacuate area.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Now lemme fix these heat sensors.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Warning. Resolving potential issue. Evacuate area.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Running short on materials. Guess I'll need to submit another order to the Procurement Department...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Resolving issue using method— method—
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Demolition.
attributes.name: Meeboo SUPER

attributes.content: Did something just move?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Mayer was not slow on the uptake, but she could have been faster if she had shaken the habit of working with her headphones on.
The Meeboo SUPER activates its detonation sequence.
Using an extendable robotic arm, Mayer manages to press the shock shield activation button just in time, deflecting the Meeboo SUPER's directional explosion.
Lutra Workshop's key areas were undamaged, but the extendable platform near the door holding heavy materials is destroyed.
Mayer watches as the Meeboo SUPER is buried in the rubble it created.
Argh!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: So... heavy...! Good thing the robotic arm charging system still works.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: What's going on, Mayer? I could hear the noise from your workshop a mile away.
Whoa, the Meeboo SUPER... looks heavily damaged.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Did it do all this?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Can't say I blame it... I told you not to use your quarters as your workshop, and not to make unauthorized modifications. Lemme check if the load-bearing structure is still intact...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What about the other places it inspected? Did it...?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I came from that way. Things look okay.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: (Good thing I set up those localized shock compensators ahead of time. Whew...)
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: How about you? You okay, Mayer?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Look at this mess. I'll help you clean up.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Just like the old days.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The workshop's a mess... just like the old days.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Don't scare me like that! You hit your head or something? You're not the type to reminisce at the drop of a hat, are you?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I mean, back when I first started on the Meeboos...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Mayer's workshop again?
Third time this month, isn't it?
Chronometer stops working, cooling system malfunction... and now the chair springs up on its own and knocks the operating table over?
It's always one thing or another pulling her away from the project and back to her lab.
And all this after she was even given her own workshop...
If she says it's a coincidence, who are we to argue? Not worth wasting time worrying about.
I was so excited to get into Rhine Lab.
For researchers, it was the holy land for all of Columbia—all of Terra, even. It had the facilities, the projects, the talent, the pay, and the benefits.

We had a consensus that science would determine the future of Terra. Within Rhine Lab itself, however, everyone had their own interpretation of science, their own obsessions. Especially the directors.
It was an uncomfortable place. Some of the finest minds in the world, but woefully inefficient when they get together, like an all-star sports team that just can't seem to win.

I was in Engineering, providing technical support for the other sections. A project started by Energy last month, which was already halfway through preparations, was facing termination because of opposition from Control.
Similarly, the Defense Section could also put a stop to ongoing projects at their discretion.
This happened again and again at Rhine Lab. Low-level staff were in a constant cycle of installation, testing, and removal.
I felt like I was better off doing research on my own.

That's why I made a trick alarm clock that caused just a teensy bit of havoc in my workshop at preset times. Not enough to put the place out of commission, but serious enough that I'd have to rush back to deal with it.
That was the first Meeboo prototype.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I gradually added more functions, and named them after the boot-up sound.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: So you'd run back to your lab, all excited to clean up the mess?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Yeah. Never made much progress on the projects they assigned me, but I sure invented plenty of little gizmos.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: After I helped her out, Silence liked some of the stuff I made and put in a recommendation. They still use 'em back at Rhine Lab, even.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: The Meeboos were always the apple of your eye, though, weren't they?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Yeah, I wanted 'em to become these crazy smart machines.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I mean, they've been by my side this whole time, from Rhine to Rhodes.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: But after countless losses, decommissions, and upgrades... there was only one 1st-gen Meeboo left.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Was built around the last 1st-gen, yeah.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.text: Meeboo SUPER Test Log 08
Internal sensor nodes malfunctioned. Major and irreversible warping of the limbs.
89.7% of the core is damaged. Repair would be difficult. There appear to be preexisting algorithmic issues, which had already manifested with the door password error.
Meeboo SUPER had worked independently for one hour prior to returning to Lutra Workshop, which was enough to overload its processing.
It saw items that operators left outside their doors as structural issues and blew them up...
That's not smart at all.
Sigh...
Analysis: The Meeboo SUPER prototype is no longer suited for practical operation.
Damage to the workshop's walls, loss of material... repairs will cost a fair bit.
Conclusion: This Meeboo upgrade is a failure.

attributes.content: Hey, no one said artificial intelligence was easy.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Don't let it get to you!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Mayer!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: The Meeboo SUPER may not have achieved its goals, but it wasn't a complete failure.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: C'mon, we can all see what happened, Closure.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: No, I'm serious, look!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The nametags of the Meeboos.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Yeah. Its limbs are all crushed and warped, but the nametags have just fallen off, completely intact.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's not like they're made of anything tougher than the main body, are they?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Wait, are you saying it...?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Could be a coincidence, or it could be some sort of 'instinct'...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: The voice module is too damaged to respond.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Beautiful! You should've seen the looks on their faces when I ditched.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: But I gotta scoot you over a little for next time. Knocking over a chair is one thing, but fixing broken equipment is a pain.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I should give you a name, huh... You know what, how about I set up a random boot-up sound for you? Whatever sound you make will be your new name!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Over here, Meeboo. I need to reset the settings for your demolition program.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo, adjust the position of the robotic arm.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo, bring me that thermal device.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Meeboo... Hey, how'd you know I wanted this calibrator?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Whoa! What are you doing? Stop pulling!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: It's just a bit of work. Not like I'm gonna forget to eat.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Er...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Fine, I get it, I'm eating, I'm eating!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.text: Mayer picks up the name tags from the ground and wipes the dirt off them.
She does so carefully, like she is organizing experimental data or putting together a precision machine.
More carefully, in fact.
Mayer has developed many things: wire-controlled machines, energy coating, transmission systems... She has become numb to the joys of creation.
Is there surprise, excitement, pride? Yes.
But nothing too intense.
This is normal for a researcher. That is why she credits her achievements to the Lutra Workshop.
Even though she is the Lutra Workshop.
The Meeboos, however, were different.
She talked to them, worked with them, killed time with them, and brought them with her from Rhine Lab to Rhodes Island.
She asked them to respond, and they did.
Mayer gazes upon the remains of the Meeboo SUPER. It was, without a doubt, a failure, but Mayer feels something she had never felt before.
Sadness? Surprise? Joy? Yes.
But it is more than that. Stronger, more complex, harder to describe.

attributes.content: So, not quite buggy tier yet, but Meeboo SUPER has made a lot of progress. Don't give up.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Can I get another two months off, then?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I want to start the next smart upgrade project based on these results! Strike while the iron is hot!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: No way, buster! I'm not falling for that!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I already gave you three months. Do you realize how many requests Engineering gets in three months?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: And you'll also need to submit a detailed report on what happened during the Meeboo SUPER's testing, especially the accident.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: And most importantly, you're paying for the Lutra Workshop's repairs out of your own pocket!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Meeboo SUPER Test Log 09
This Meeboo upgrade has failed.
But the Meeboos are by Mayer's side. The possibilities are infinite.
Mayer trusts Meeboo.
Mayer trusts Mayer.
